title: Pro Bono Institute Opens Search For President And CEO
text:
Pro Bono Institute (PBI)
WASHINGTON , Oct. 13, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Pro Bono Institute (PBI) is accepting applications for the position of President and CEO. PBI is the respected resource for all things pro bono in the legal profession, with an unparalleled depth of knowledge, resources and expertise.
The new President and CEO will bring significant expertise and knowledge of pro bono, a global perspective, and an unparalleled passion for the field. The ideal candidate is a visionary, an exceptional leader, an effective strategic manager, and a superb communicator.
Esther F. Lardent founded PBI in 1996 and has led the organization for the past 19 years until her transition to strategic advisor this summer. "PBI has transformed the pro bono sector under the extraordinary leadership of Esther Lardent ," said Jim Jones , Chair of the PBI Board of Directors. "The Board and our distinguished group of stakeholders are immensely grateful for Esther's leadership and passion. The new President and CEO will have a unique opportunity to build on her tremendous success and chart the path forward for pro bono."
PBI is a global leader in identifying and implementing new approaches to and resources for the provision of legal services to the poor, disadvantaged and other individuals or groups unable to secure legal assistance to address critical problems. This impact is achieved through its work with law firms, in-house corporate legal departments and public interest organizations.
PBI's rigorous empirical research and analysis, white papers, reports, advice and support allow it to transform the concept and practice of pro bono. By providing expert consultations and technical assistance; educational programming; and local, national and global pro bono convening; PBI's goal is to constantly improve and enrich pro bono service.
PBI has retained LeaderFit to lead the search. Interested candidates may submit their application here or direct inquiries to Annie Linehan Czerwinski , Partner, at aczerwinski@leaderfit.org or on 202-210-8629.
